definitions.definition: an act, statement, or gift that is intended to show gratitude, respect, or admiration.
examples: the video is a tribute to the musicals of the '40s
synonyms: offering; bouquet; formalencomium "tributes flooded in from friends and colleagues"praise
extol; formallaud "the players on both teams paid tribute to the retiring Ripken"

definitions.definition: something resulting from something else and indicating its worth.
examples: his victory in the championship was a tribute to his persistence
synonyms: attestation "it is a tribute to his courage that he ever played again"

definitions.definition: denoting or relating to a group or musician that performs the music of a more famous one and typically imitates them in appearance and style of performance.
payment made periodically by one state or ruler to another, especially as a sign of dependence.
examples: the king had at his disposal plunder and tribute amassed through warfare

definitions.definition: a proportion of ore or its equivalent, paid to a miner for his work, or to the owner or lessor of a mine.
